title: U.S. Lawmakers Call For More Oversight Of Workers' Comp
text:
James Ratliff • 28 sec ago 
republicans are Americas and the planets worst enemy.We have to start treating them as the enemy they are! posted on Exxon's Funding Of Climate Denial Turned Americans Against Facts sdk7148 • 29 sec ago 
It is about time. Taking advantage of criminals cannot be seen as the next growth opportunity for nefarious businesses. posted on FCC Regulates Prison Phone Call Prices: No More $14 A Minute Rates Cafone • 35 sec ago 
Trump is for taxing wall street speculation and against the TPP. Tell me again why I should vote for Hillary Clinton over him if they are the two nominees. Bill O'Neil • 48 sec ago 
Didn't you hear? Alex Jones said that was all just a hoax! Kathy Knight • 1 min ago 
His ridiculous argument that you can't be poor and/or hungry if you have a television set ignores that people's situations can change. You can be broke, not poor, broke. Used to have a job, now you don't. Are you really going to sell your tv to buy groceries? Of course not. And even if you could, used tvs don't bring much. It would be a last ditch frantic effort with little result.
